title: CCI okays Dalmia Bharat's proposal to acquire Jaiprakash Associates
summary: The Competition Commission of India (CCI) has approved Dalmia Bharat's resolution plan to acquire the debt-laden Jaiprakash Associates Ltd (JAL) through the insolvency resolution process. Several other entities, including Adani Enterprises and Vedanta Group, have also sought...
fullContent: The Competition Commission of India (CCI) has approved Dalmia Bharat's resolution plan to acquire the debt-laden Jaiprakash Associates Ltd (JAL) through the insolvency resolution process. Several other entities, including Adani Enterprises and Vedanta Group, have also sought CCI approval to submit their resolution plans. JAL, undergoing CIRP after defaulting on loans, has significant real estate and cement assets.

title: India's forex reserves at 11-month high of merchandise exports: RBI Guv Sanjay Malhotra
summary: RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra announced that India's forex reserves have reached an 11-month high relative to merchandise exports. The reserves increased by $2.7 billion, reaching $698.19 billion for the week ending July 25, according to RBI data.
fullContent: RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra announced that India's forex reserves have reached an 11-month high relative to merchandise exports. The reserves increased by $2.7 billion, reaching $698.19 billion for the week ending July 25, according to RBI data. The RBI intervenes in the market to manage liquidity and prevent excessive rupee depreciation, maintaining orderly market conditions.

fullContent: NCDEX has received in-principle approval from Sebi to launch its equity and equity derivatives segment, subject to certain conditions including maintaining robust commodity volumes and IT timelines. This move diversifies NCDEX's offerings and positions it against competitors like MSE, leveraging its rural penetration.

title: RBI Monetary Policy Committee keeps repo rate unchanged at 5.50%
summary: The Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) of the Reserve Bank of India (RBI), chaired by Governor Sanjay Malhotra, met from August 4 to August 6, 2025, for its third bi-monthly monetary policy review of the financial year 2025–26.
fullContent: The Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) of the Reserve Bank of India (RBI), chaired by Governor Sanjay Malhotra, met from August 4 to August 6, 2025, for its third bi-monthly monetary policy review of the financial year 2025–26. The committee decided to keep the repo rate unchanged at 5.50 percent, pausing after three consecutive rate cuts earlier this year.

title: RBI Monetary Policy Committee keeps repo rate unchanged at 5.50%
summary: The RBI on Wednesday kept the repo rate unchanged at 5.50 percent after its August 4–6 policy meeting, pausing after three cuts this year. Despite rising trade risks from new US tariffs, the MPC retained its FY26 GDP forecast to 6.5 percent and lowered inflation to 3.1 percent.
fullContent: The RBI on Wednesday kept the repo rate unchanged at 5.50 percent after its August 4–6 policy meeting, pausing after three cuts this year. Despite rising trade risks from new US tariffs, the MPC retained its FY26 GDP forecast to 6.5 percent and lowered inflation to 3.1 percent.

fullContent: When the closing price moves above the VWAP, it signifies that the stock closed higher than the average price at which it was traded throughout the day – an average weighted by trading volume.

summary: Hong Kong flag carrier Cathay Pacific Airways has reported a 1.1 per cent year-on-year increase in its net profit for the first six months of 2025 to HK$3.65 billion (US$465 million), thanks to a resilient cargo business amid the US-China trade war, as it places a new plane...
fullContent: Hong Kong flag carrier Cathay Pacific Airways has reported a 1.1 per cent year-on-year increase in its net profit for the first six months of 2025 to HK$3.65 billion (US$465 million), thanks to a resilient cargo business amid the US-China trade war, as it places a new plane order. title: Rich investors follow sell-on-rise mantra in Swiggy, 10 other stocks. Are you still buying?
summary: Despite market gains, HNIs booked profits in stocks like Swiggy and Waaree Energies, signaling a sell-on-rise strategy. While some analysts remain optimistic, profit booking and portfolio reshuffling may be driving HNI exits.
fullContent: Despite market gains, HNIs booked profits in stocks like Swiggy and Waaree Energies, signaling a sell-on-rise strategy. While some analysts remain optimistic, profit booking and portfolio reshuffling may be driving HNI exits. Retail investors should note that even wealthy investors prioritize taking profits when stocks surge.

title: NSDL shares list at 10% premium over issue price
summary: NSDL shares debuted on the stock exchanges on August 6, achieving a premium over the IPO price of Rs 800. The Rs 4,012 crore IPO witnessed substantial oversubscription, particularly from QIBs. NSDL, a key player in India's dematerialized securities market, reported revenue and...
fullContent: NSDL shares debuted on the stock exchanges on August 6, achieving a premium over the IPO price of Rs 800. The Rs 4,012 crore IPO witnessed substantial oversubscription, particularly from QIBs. NSDL, a key player in India's dematerialized securities market, reported revenue and profit growth in FY25, attracting long-term investors due to its institutional importance and dividend history.

title: FMCG Firms Cut Senior Roles By 25% Amid AI Disruption, Tepid Growth
summary: Among top companies, HUL saw an 8.5% decrease in its permanent employee count, while Dabur reduced its hiring by over 6%. Similar trends were observed at Nestle India, Godrej Consumer, and Emami.

title: Pharma stocks in focus as Trump warns tariffs could hit 250%
summary: Pharma stocks such as Sun Pharma, Cipla, Dr Reddy’s Laboratories, Lupin, and others will be in focus on Wednesday after US President Donald Trump said tariffs on imported pharmaceuticals could rise to as high as 250%.
fullContent: Pharma stocks such as Sun Pharma, Cipla, Dr Reddy’s Laboratories, Lupin, and others will be in focus on Wednesday after US President Donald Trump said tariffs on imported pharmaceuticals could rise to as high as 250%. The proposed tariffs would start at a lower rate but escalate over time, he said in a CNBC interview.

fullContent: OpenAI's private stock is in such high demand that the company is looking to potentially conduct a secondary share sale at a $500 billion valuation.

title: Chinese nationals charged with exporting Nvidia AI chips to China
summary: Chuan Geng and Shiwei Yang are accused of exporting the chips from the US to China through Singapore and Malaysia.
fullContent: Chuan Geng and Shiwei Yang are accused of exporting the chips from the US to China through Singapore and Malaysia.
